meanings.sent1: The old train chugged along the branchlines through the countryside.
meanings.sent2: The branchlines connected smaller towns to the main railway network.
meanings.sent3: The branchlines were like the veins of the transportation system, carrying passengers and goods.
meanings.sent4: She followed the branchlines of the story, exploring the smaller details that led to the main plot.
meanings.sent5: The branchlines crisscrossed the landscape, creating a web of travel possibilities.

meanings.definition: A division of a business or organization
meanings.sent1: The marketing branchlines of the company focused on advertising and promotions.
meanings.sent2: Each branchlines of the corporation had its own specific tasks and responsibilities.
meanings.sent3: The branchlines of the organization worked together like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent4: She navigated the branchlines of the company hierarchy to understand its structure.
meanings.sent5: The branchlines of the business expanded rapidly, reaching new markets and customers.

meanings.definition: To diverge or spread out from a main line or part
meanings.sent1: The river branchlines off into smaller streams as it flows through the valley.
meanings.sent2: The hiking trail branchlines into different paths, offering various levels of difficulty.
meanings.sent3: His thoughts branchlines into different ideas, making it hard to focus on just one.
meanings.sent4: The project branchlines into multiple phases, each requiring specific attention.
meanings.sent5: Her creativity branchlines in unexpected directions, leading to unique solutions.
